thread.title: Minnesota Lynx, Indiana Fever to meet in rematch of 2012 WNBA Finals
thread.title_full: Minnesota Lynx, Indiana Fever to meet in rematch of 2012 WNBA Finals | The Seattle Times

author: JON KRAWCZYNSKI
title: Minnesota Lynx, Indiana Fever to meet in rematch of 2012 WNBA Finals
text:
MINNEAPOLIS – Maya Moore and the Minnesota Lynx waltzed into the 2012 WNBA Finals ready for a coronation.
It was supposed to be the beginning of a dynasty, with the powerful Lynx sure to overwhelm heavy underdog Indiana for their second straight championship.
Tamika Catchings had other ideas.
Catchings and the Fever took it to the defending champions, stunning them in Game 1 in Minnesota and taking the best-of-five series 3-1 for the franchise’s lone championship.
  Three years later, the teams are meeting again for the title. And this time, Moore said, the Lynx will be ready for the Fever.
“Coming into the Finals that year, feeling like we weren’t as mentally tough as we needed to be,” Moore recalled. “It was a great lesson for us.”
The Lynx are in the Finals for the fourth time in five years. They won the title in 2011 and 2013.
“We just have to believe in ourselves and not worry about what anyone else says,” said Fever forward Catchings, 36. “We know what we’re capable of doing.”
JON KRAWCZYNSKI
